org.jtrim.concurrent

Class Tasks

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.concurrent.Tasks

  • public final class Tasks
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines static methods to return simple, convenient task related instances.

    This class cannot be inherited nor instantiated.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • noOpTask

        public static java.lang.Runnable noOpTask()
        Returns a Runnable whose run() method does nothing but returns immediately to the caller.
        Returns:
        a Runnable whose run() method does nothing but returns immediately to the caller. This method never returns null.

      • noOpCancelableTask

        public static CancelableTask noOpCancelableTask()
        Returns a CancelableTask whose execute method does nothing but returns immediately to the caller.
        Returns:
        a CancelableTask whose execute method does nothing but returns immediately to the caller. This method never returns null.

      • runOnceTask

        public static java.lang.Runnable runOnceTask(java.lang.Runnable task,
                             boolean failOnReRun)
        Returns a Runnable which will execute the specified Runnable but will execute the specified Runnable only once. The specified task will not be executed more than once even if it is called multiple times concurrently (and is allowed to be called concurrently).

        What happens when the returned task is attempted to be executed depends on the failOnReRun argument. If the argument is true, attempting to call the run method of the returned Runnable multiple times will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown. If the argument is false, calling the run method of the returned Runnable multiple times will only result in a single execution and every other call (not actually executing the specified Runnable) will silently return without doing anything.

        Parameters:
        task - the Runnable to which calls are to be forwarded by the returned Runnable. This method cannot be null.
        failOnReRun - if true multiple calls to the run() method of the returned Runnable will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown. If this argument is false subsequent calls after the first call to the run() method of the returned Runnable will silently return without doing anything.
        Returns:
        the Runnable which will execute the specified Runnable but will execute the specified Runnable only once. This method never returns null.

      • runOnceCancelableTask

        public static CancelableTask runOnceCancelableTask(CancelableTask task,
                                   boolean failOnReRun)
        Returns a CancelableTask which will execute the specified CancelableTask (forwarding the arguments passed to it) but will execute the specified CancelableTask only once. The specified task will not be executed more than once even if it is called multiple times concurrently (and is allowed to be called concurrently).

        What happens when the returned task is attempted to be executed depends on the failOnReRun argument. If the argument is true, attempting to call the execute method of the returned CancelableTask multiple times will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown. If the argument is false, calling the CancelableTask method of the returned CancelableTask multiple times will only result in a single execution and every other call (not actually executing the specified CancelableTask) will silently return without doing anything.

        Parameters:
        task - the CancelableTask to which calls are to be forwarded by the returned CancelableTask. This method cannot be null.
        failOnReRun - if true multiple calls to the CancelableTask method of the returned CancelableTask will cause an IllegalStateException to be thrown. If this argument is false subsequent calls after the first call to the CancelableTask method of the returned CancelableTask will silently return without doing anything.
        Returns:
        the CancelableTask which will execute the specified CancelableTask but will execute the specified CancelableTask only once. This method never returns null.

      • canceledTaskFuture

        public static <V> TaskFuture<V> canceledTaskFuture()
        Returns a TaskFuture which is already in the TaskState.DONE_CANCELED state. Note that the state of the returned TaskFuture will never change.

        Attempting the retrieve the result of the returned TaskFuture will immediately throw an OperationCanceledException without waiting.

        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of the result of the returned TaskFuture. Note that the returned TaskFuture will enver actually return anything of this type (not even null).
        Returns:
        the TaskFuture which is already in the TaskState.DONE_CANCELED state. This method never returns null.
